description:
Sporting designer clothes, make-up, and nails, Ran Kotobuki is the very picture of a trendy, young Shibuya girl, but don't let that fool you. This girl comes from a family of cops, and she’s ready to lay you out flat if you even think about causing trouble in her town! At least, she will... when she’s not distracted with karaoke, shopping, and dodging her homework. Join Ran and her friends as they defend the streets of Shibuya and attempt to shop their way into the history books as the most famous Gals ever!

(Source: RightStuf)

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other director](https://anilist.co/staff/242744/) by the same name._
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.
A Japanese anime director, storyboard artist, and animator.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

**Height:** 161 cm
**Birth name:** Emi Oota (太田絵美)
**Current Stage Name:** Emi Oota (太田衣美)

**Height:** 161 cm
**Birth name:** Emi Oota (太田絵美)
**Current Stage Name:** Emi Oota (太田衣美)

Yuuji Nunokawa was a planner, producer, as well as the founder and representative director of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/).

Worked at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) as an animator and director through the '70s before becoming a producer.
